Despite scheduled reductions in the CF according to the SGR formula, the most recent year with a CF reduction was 2002. Since then, Congress has annually overridden scheduled reductions (colloquially known as the Ã¢â¬Ådoc fixÃ¢â¬Â). Most recently, the Medicare Access and CHIP Reauthorization Act of 2015 removed the SGR formula used to determine the CF. In its place, the act provided a half-percent increase in the physician fee schedule rate until 2020 (Clough and McClellan, 2016).
